medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting after alcohol and greasy food intake.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Sudden onset of uncomfortable abdominal pain in the epigastric region, awakening the patient from sleep on the evening prior to admission. Persistent pain since that time with associated nausea and non-bloody vomiting. The patient has had no appetite but was able to keep some liquid down in the morning.
medical_history.family_history: Denies a family history of pancreatic or gallbladder disease.
medical_history.social_history: Tobacco use disorder; alcohol consumption noted (4 shots of tequila before onset of symptoms).
